content.text: @dankvr retweeted @armaniferrante: 'You can't talk about decentralization and transparency without seeing the source code. If the source code is private, it has all the same risk as a centralized operator.' @dankvr also retweeted @ClementDelangue who emphasized that closed-source AI will destroy jobs and benefit only the richest companies, while open-source AI can foster competition and decentralization of value.

contributing_tweets.author: armaniferrante
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: You can't talk about decentralization and transparency without seeing the source code. If the source code is private, it has all the same risk as a centralized operator. There are no exceptions to this. Stop letting people gaslight you....

contributing_tweets.author: ClementDelangue
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
If AI stays closed-source, proprietary and monopolistic like it is now, it will destroy lots of jobs and just make the richest companies richer and more powerful!

If we open it up thanks to open science and open-source, foster competition and decentralization of value and...

content.text: @dankvr retweeted @brave: 'Chrome is dropping support for ad blockers but Brave will keep blocking ads.' This highlights ongoing concerns about privacy and ad-blocking capabilities in web browsers.

contributing_tweets.author: brave
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: Chrome is dropping support for ad blockers but Brave will keep blocking ads. https://t.co/IQSSEBb8Fy...

content.text: @dankvr is developing tools for community governance, including sentiment analysis systems that summarize data from various sources (GitHub, Discord, Twitter) and generate interactive content like AI-powered talkshows and surveys. He describes this as 'reimagining online governance by upcycling raw community data into interactive media with programmable talking heads' to lower barriers to participation.

contributing_tweets.author: dankvr
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
Low friction sentiment gathering loop:
- Automatically summarize data from various sources like github, discord, twitter, APIs -> public data lake
- Generate animated talkshows with AI deliberating trending topics related to our DAO + AI-powered surveys in token gated channels...

contributing_tweets.author: dankvr
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: Reimagining online governance by upcycling raw community data (forums, github, discord, etc) into interactive media with programmable talking heads as a way to lower the barrier to meaningful participation...

content.text: @dankvr shared a video demonstrating a system that associates wallets with GitHub profiles without requiring signatures, using hidden comments on GitHub profiles. This relates to the ElizaOS ecosystem's efforts to connect with contributors. @elizaOS also posted about development responsibilities with some apparent frustration.

contributing_tweets.author: dankvr
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: Made a quick video of how our system associates wallets with GitHub. No signing anything. It relies on creating a hidden comment to a user's github profile that we read from. Very slick imo, the PR if interested: https://t.co/XlmFqorO9M https://t.co/atoQ5HRPAL...

contributing_tweets.author: elizaOS
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: I reason I recall I deploy but sure let me do your laundry too  -_- https://t.co/Q2wMuT7zVy...

content.text: @dankvr expressed that sometimes people need to be pushed to learn AI tools, stating 'Sometimes you gotta drag ppl to learn / take seriously to git gud at using AI. They'll be thankful later.' Meanwhile, @shawmakesmagic predicted 'We are a few months away from self optimizing PyTorch,' suggesting rapid advancement in AI development frameworks.

contributing_tweets.author: dankvr
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: Sometimes you gotta drag ppl to learn / take seriously to git gud at using AI. They’ll be thankful later....

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: We are a few months away from self optimizing PyTorch...

content.text: From May 31 to June 1, 2025, the elizaOS/eliza repository showed significant activity with 5 new pull requests (4 of which were merged), 1 new issue, and 10 active contributors participating in the project.
PR #4857 by @wtfsayo titled 'Revert "feat: update agent configuration on restart and move ensureAgentExist…"' is merged.
PR #4860 by @geooner titled 'fix: add missing GET /agents/:agentId/rooms/:roomId API endpoint' is open.
PR #4842 titled 'Add enhanced Polymarket plugin with comprehensive trading actions and…' is merged.
PR #4859 titled 'fix: choice action null check' is merged as a bugfix.
PR #4858 titled 'agent thinking + disable messaging for inactive agents' is merged.
Issue #4855 titled 'The Chinese document has been deleted.' by @debugzhao is OPEN with no comments since its creation on May 31, 2025.
